metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29948 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
Signatures are written to disk before and read during verification, which might be subject to a race condition when a malicious local process or user is replacing the file. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.10.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-29948` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
